steps.title: Welcome!
paragraphs: Welcome to the home page of your organization's Framaspace.
Would you like to follow a short tutorial to learn how to use Framaspace?
On the Dashboard, you'll find an overview of what happened recently on this Framaspace.
The Recommended files are this Framaspace's files that have been recently created or modified.
The Upcoming events are events on your calendars and those shared with you.
Click Customize to add or remove elements to the Dashbboard.
This will only affect your interface. It won't have any effect on other users!
Find your Framaspace's apps here.
You logged in with a user name and password.
Access your account's information with this button.
You can find and change your personal information by clicking here.
You can find every available tutorial by clicking on the Intros button.
You can enable or disable the tutorial of any app with this menu.

steps.title: See you!
paragraphs: This is the end of this app's tutorial.
You can follow other apps' tutorials with the following buttons:

steps.title: Welcome!
paragraphs: Welcome to the tutorial of the Files app, the core of your Framaspace!
You can find all your files and folders at the center of this page.
The New button allow you to add new files or folders to Framaspace.
Upload a file from your computer to Framaspace...
... or create a file or folder from Framaspace right away.
The side panel gives you access to the recently used files (Recent) or the trashbin (Deleted files).
Click the three dots to see all the possible actions on a file or folder.
For example: Rename, Download or Delete.
Files and folders on Framaspace aren't available to everyone by default.
Click on the share button to find out more about the sharing options after this tutorial is over.

steps.title: See you!
paragraphs: This is the end of this app's tutorial.
You can follow other apps' tutorials with the following buttons:

steps.title: Sharing files
paragraphs: Welcome to the file sharing tutorial.
You can create an internal sharing link to share a file or folder to your organization's members.
This link will only be accessible to people in your organization!
You can also create a public link for anyone to access, and define whether people can see or modify the element.
To share a file or folder via e-mail, provide the e-mail address of the person you want to share this file or folder to, and choose whether they can see or modify the element.

steps.title: See you!
paragraphs: This is the end of this tutorial.

steps.title: Welcome!
paragraphs: This section gives you access to your personal information.
Your profile is always accessible in the top-right corner. You can access your personal information from there.
You can change your name, profile picture or even your title in your organization in the Personal info menu.
The Security section allows you to change your password if needed.
The Notifications allows you to choose if you want to receive emails when there is activity on this Framaspace.

steps.title: See you!
paragraphs: This is the end of this app's tutorial.
You can follow other apps' tutorials with the following buttons:

steps.title: Welcome!
paragraphs: Organize your events with your organization's members with the Calendar app.
The central calendar shows all the events that are shared with you or that you have created yourself.
You can change the period's length in this menu.
The Today button centers the calendar on the current day, week or month.
Calendars you have access to (created by you or shared to you) are available here.
Create a new calendar to add it to the list with this button.
You can share a calendar using the pen icon.
You can create a new event and add it to a calendar here.
You can import events from another calendar (e.g. from a .ics file) with the button in the Calendar settings.

steps.title: See you!
paragraphs: This is the end of this app's tutorial.

steps.title: Welcome!
paragraphs: Store your personal contacts in the Contacts app. Other users won't have access to them by default.
Click here to add a contact and add their name and information.
You can also import a set of contacts from another application in the Contacts settings.
Organize your contacts with Contacts groups.
These are your groups, they are not public.
With Circles, create groups of people whom you can share data with (e.g. people in your organization who have access to finance-related files).

steps.title: Welcome!
paragraphs: The Talk app allows you to chat or video call within Framaspace.
Find your existing conversations here.
Create a new group chat with this button.
You can also choose to chat with someone by searching their name in the search bar.
